Natural Object.definition: a person likely to be the recipient of some thing or action ;esp
Natural Object.origin: [widows and children, who, as the natural objects of a testator's bounty, wereâ€¦residuary legatees " Lomon v. Citizens Nat'l. Bank & Trust of Muskogee , 689 P.2d 306 (1984)"]

1.1: a person likely to be the recipient of some thing or action

2.1: a person who is close to or related to a person dying whether testate or intestate, who would reasonably be expected to receive a share of the estate, and who may be so recognized in the absence of a will or in a will contest usually used in the phrase
